Anggaran Janggal di Dinas Pendidikan DKI Jakarta Nyaris Rp 2,5 T
07 Nov 2019, 22:55 by Adam Prireza, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anggota DPRD DKI dari Fraksi PDIP, Ima Mahdiah, membongkar 27 mata anggaran janggal di Dinas Pendidikan DKI Jakarta pada rancangan APBD DKI 2020. Nilainya nyaris mencapai Rp 2,5 triliun.
Ima menyatakan menemukan anggaran-anggaran janggal tersebut setelah menyisir dokumen Kebijakan Umum Anggaran dan Prioritas Plafon Anggaran Sementara (KUA-PPAS) 2020 terbaru.
“Temuan ini sumbernya di dokumen yang sudah direvisi dan terbaru. Yang total anggarannya Rp 89 triliun,” kata Ima saat ditemui di ruang kerjanya, Gedung DPRD DKI, Jakarta Pusat, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Eks staf Gubernur DKI Jakarta terdahulu, Basuki Tjahja Purnama atau Ahok, tersebut menyoroti anggaran dengan total nilai jumbo dan peruntukan yang tak masuk di akal. Misalnya anggaran pengadaan pasir dan helm proyek.
Menurut dia, anggaran tersebut aneh karena bukan untuk merehabilitasi sekolah. Pengadaan pasir itu, kata Ima, masuk dalam kelompok alat peraga yang ditujukan untuk sekolah seperti SMPN, SMK jurusan bisnis manajemen, serta SMK jurusan teknologi. Dalam dokumen tersebut, kata Ima, pengadaan pasir bukan untuk rehabilitasi sekolah.
“Di luar dari rehab. Ini Bantuan Operasional Pendidikan (BOP). Itu kami telusuri,” ucap Ima. “Enggak tau apa yang digunakan dari pasir (untuk pelajar),” tambah dia.
Dia pun menunjukkan 27 item mata anggaran janggal yang bakal di pertanyakan dalam rapat Badan Anggaran DPRD DKI pekan depan. Berikut adalah rincian komponen belanja tersebut:
1. Ballpoint: Rp 633,6 miliar2. Tinta printer: Rp 258,3 miliar3. Laptop: Rp 217,4 miliar4. Komputer PC: Rp 206,7 miliar5. Kertas F4: Rp 186,7 miliar6. Buku guru tematik kelas II: Rp 127,7 miliar7. Lem aibon: Rp 126,2 miliar8. Meja tulis: Rp 105,3 miliar9. Buku folio: Rp 78,7 miliar10. Tinta/toner printer: Rp 59,1 miliar11. Kursi murid: Rp 53,04 miliar12. Pasir: Rp 52,1 miliar13. Tinta printer laserjet: Rp 43,4 miliar14. Thinner: Rp 40,1 miliar15. Balliner: Rp 37,3 miliar16. Helm proyek: Rp 34,2 miliar17. Kalkulator: Rp 31,6 miliar18. Penghapus cair: Rp 31,6 miliar19. Tinta Fujixerox Docuprint 3105 (CT350936): Rp 26,05 miliar20. Cat minyak berwarna: Rp 19,7 miliar21. Cat tembok: Rp 18,9 miliar22. Kaca bening: Rp 18,5 miliar23. Toner printer: Rp 16,5 miliar24. Penjilidan buku registrasi akta catatan sipil: Rp 16,1 miliar25. Rotring: Rp 15,6 miliar26. Lemari: Rp 10,4 miliar27. Air mineral: Rp 10,1 miliar
Berdasarkan perhitungan Tempo, jumlah total anggaran janggal yang ditemukan Ima mencapai Rp 2,474 triliun. Ima menyatakan keseluruhan mata anggaran itu diusulkan oleh Dinas Pendidikan DKI Jakarta.
Sebelumnya anggaran janggal Dinas Pendidikan DKI Jakarta juga menjadi sorotan setelah Anggota DPRD DKI dari Fraksi PSI, William Aditya Sarana, membongkar anggaran lem aibon dan ballpoint bernilai masing-masing Rp 82 miliar dan Rp 123 miliar.

Budgetary Budget in Education Agency of DKI Jakarta is Nearly Rp. 2.5 T
Nov 7 2019, 22:55 by Adam Prireza, Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - DKI DPRD member from the PDIP faction, Ima Mahdiah, dismantled 27 odd budget items in the DKI Jakarta Education Agency in the 2020 DKI APBD draft. The value is almost reached Rp 2.5 trillion.
Ima said that she found the odd budget after combing the latest 2020 Provisional Budget Policy and Priority Ceiling (KUA-PPAS) document.
"These findings are sourced from revised and up to date documents. The total budget of Rp 89 trillion, "said Ima when met in his office, DKI Jakarta Parliament Building, Central Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
The former Jakarta Capital City Governor, Basuki Tjahja Purnama or Ahok, highlighted the budget with a total value of jumbo and unreasonable designation. For example the budget for the procurement of sand and helmet projects.
According to him, the budget is strange because it is not to rehabilitate schools. The sand procurement, said Ima, is included in the teaching aids intended for schools such as SMPN, SMK majoring in business management, and SMK majoring in technology. In the document, said Ima, the procurement of sand is not for school rehabilitation.
"Out of rehab. This is Operational Education Assistance (BOP). We traced it, "said Ima. "I don't know what is used from sand (for students)," he added.
He also pointed out 27 items of odd budget items that would be questioned at the DKI DPRD Budget Board meeting next week. Following are the details of the shopping components:
1. Ballpoint: IDR 633.6 billion2. Printer ink: IDR 258.3 billion3. Laptop: IDR 217.4 billion4 PC computer: IDR 206.7 billion5. Paper F4: Rp. 186.7 billion6. Class II thematic teacher's book: Rp. 127.7 billion7. Aibon glue: Rp. 126.2 billion8. Desk: IDR 105.3 billion9. Folio book: IDR 78.7 billion10. Printer ink / toner: IDR 59.1 billion11. Student seats: Rp. 53.04 billion12. Sand: Rp. 52.1 billion13. Laserjet printer ink: IDR 43.4 billion14. Thinner: IDR 40.1 billion15. Balliner: Rp.37.3 billion16. Project helmet: Rp. 34.2 billion17. Calculator: Rp. 31.6 billion18. Liquid eraser: Rp. 31.6 billion19. Ink Fujixerox Docuprint 3105 (CT350936): IDR 26.05 billion20. Color oil paint: Rp. 19.7 billion21. Wall paint: Rp. 18.9 billion22. Clear glass: Rp. 18.5 billion23. Printer toner: IDR 16.5 billion24. Bookbinding of civil registration certificate bindings: IDR 16.1 billion25. Rotring: Rp. 15.6 billion26. Cabinets: IDR 10.4 billion27. Mineral water: Rp. 10.1 billion
Based on Tempo's calculations, the total odd budget discovered by Ima reached Rp 2.474 trillion. Ima said that the whole budget item was proposed by the DKI Jakarta Education Agency.
Previously, the DKI Jakarta Education Agency's awkward budget was also highlighted after the DKI DPRD Member from the PSI Faction, William Aditya Sarana, dismantled the budget of aibon glue and ballpoint worth Rp 82 billion and Rp 123 billion respectively.
